page.title: 01 Gazetteer
page.content: Most of our area lies in the Peak Natonal Park.The land rises to 381 metres between the Ewden Beck in the north and the River Loxley in the south.Moorland with cotton grass, bilberry and heather is evident. Some moorland has been drained and fertilized. A small area has oilseed rape growing. Grass is grown for winter fodder and animals graze in some fields. Two areas have been planted with coniferous trees in the last 50 years. There are also a few wedges of deciduous woodland around tributary streams.Narrow roads twist, rise and fall haphazardly around. Stone walls separate the fields. The spoil heaps of a quarry look like giant mole hills.Old stone farmhouses are scattered around.The area is only about 15 minutes from the centre of Sheffield by car.
